runs.comm: keeps it flat and on the pads as Williamson clips to square leg
tosses this up, but it's too far down the leg side. Guptill is wary of that as he leaves
good length ball on off stump, punched to midwicket off the back foot
shuffles across as this shortish ball doesn't spin. Guptill cuts uppishly, but he's hit it square enough of backward point
nudged off his pads towards midwicket
he has smoked that! Pitched it short and Guptill has pulled it with every bit of power he can muster. Van Week is the man in the deep, does quite well to keep it to a single
teases him outside off as he gives this a little bit more air. Williamson strides out to drive through the covers and is beaten
short delivery outside off, Guptill flashes and misses
goes fuller but keeps it wide of off stump, Guptill refuses to play
gets closer to off stump and Guptill presses forward and strikes mid-off
misfield at short fine leg allows a freebie of a couple. This was shortish and outside off, but Guptill has turned it around behind square on the leg side. Impulsive puller he is
back of a good length outside off, pushed down to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, he stands up tall and thumps to cover
shortish and sliding down leg, Guptil pulls but doesn't time it at all. Finds short fine leg when he should have beaten him comfortably
fullish and just outside off, he comes forward and blocks
slower ball and he was a little too enthusiastic as he found one pitched in his area. The drive goes off the bottom of the bat to long-on
skips down the track and punches it back to the bowler. Shortened the length as he saw the batsman advancing, but that didn't hurt Williamson's timing. Just his placement
slower, good length ball just outside off, dabbed towards point
carted it over wide long-on. Another attempted slower ball, but Williamson has picked it, waited for it and smoked it over the infield
full and outside off, Guptill comes forward and pummels this to mid-off

clears his front leg and lashes outside off, but there was just a bit more bounce that he expected. Thin outside edge pouched by the keeper and Netherlands are over the moon! Good pace from van der Gugten as he bent his back and kept the line just a shade outside off. Guptill was looking to force the pace and succumbs
tempts him outside off with a fuller delivery, Baz goes for a drive on the up but he's mis-hit it towards point

back of a length on off stump, tapped beside his feet and he sets off for a quick single. The bowler races forwards from his followthrough to effect a run-out, but Williamson is quick enough to beat the direct hit. Struck the gloves, actually with a bit of nip back
fullish on off stump, nudged wide of mid-on
slashes and finds the gap between point and short third man. Just enough width for him to throw his bat and we know what happens when Baz gets it off the middle
nice tight line on middle, Williamson is on the back foot and tucks it away to midwicket
offcutter on middle, Williamson races down the track and slices to point
back of a length on leg stump, worked off his hips into the midwicket region. Soft hands allows the single
low full toss on off stump, pushed back at the bowler. Strikes him on the ankle and he's hobbling a bit here. He's struggling, but he'll complete the over
use of the feet again and he peppers the straight boundary. Beats a leaping Bukhari and the long-on fielder as well
lovely placement from Williamson. The bowler strays on his pads and he picks him away square of short fine leg. Neat little tuck fetches the second boundary of the over
fullish on middle and leg, comes forward to block
good length ball on off stump, squeezed away in front of point for a quick single
slower ball fosters the outside edge as Williamson was stuck in his crease. Scurries away to the third man boundary, but the bowler takes points on that
skips down the track to push to mid-off, who misfields. Ben Cooper, after a horrid little innings, fumbles a straight forward chance to prevent the couple
fullish and wide outside off, Williamson cuts to point and the butter fingers bug has infected him as well
races down the track and thumps a length ball over mid-off. No danger in that once he cleared the infield and he knew that better than anyone
fullish and outside off, dabbed behind to third man
keeps it nice and tight on middle and off, turned away towards midwicket
full on off stump, clipped away through midwicket
floats it up outside off and he's drilled it down to long-off
this one held up in the pitch as Borren was hoping for. McCullum was also pushing at the ball hard, as Borren had been hoping for. But the ball drops short of the bowler's extended right hand
full delivery, clipped off his pads through midwicket.
flighted just outside off, pushed into the covers
short and flat on middle as he backs away and thumps through extra cover. Long-off was running around to pull it back, but his dive ends up useless. Ben Cooper is the man again, today is not his day
slows it up and tosses it up just outside off, Williamson was hanging back and dabs towards backward point
slices this away to the sweeper in the deep
bit too short on that occasion as Baz rocks back and pulls to deep square leg. Nervous times in the deep for Netherlands as this seemed all set to sneak through as well
his flight and dip dupes Williamson again! Chasing down the track to smite it over extra, but ends up inside edging towards midwicket
slower ball deceives the batsman. Logan van Week is the new bowler and he keeps a good length ball outside off. McCullum was racing down the track and had made too much room
takes it on the up and drives through the covers.

the ump takes his time and then nods. Slower ball fetches the outside edge and Williamson walks back. Sees a bit of width and looks to steer it down to third man, but the change in pace has done him over
shuffles across and punches the back of a length delivery to the sweeper on the off side
fullish and outside off, Baz comes forward and strikes it through the covers
change in pace again, but Taylor plays with the straight bat and pushes down to mid-off
good length ball on middle, turned away through midwicket
shortish and outside off, Baz backs away and cuts to deep cover
back of a length just outside off, tapped away to long-on
fullish and outside off, he strides forward and pushes into the covers
full on middle, Taylor's clipped to deep midwicket. Single off each ball of the over so far
whipped away off his pads to deep midwicket to complete the over

and there it is, not quite the prettiest one though. Looks for the reverse scoop, but it's a bit too full. Adjusts with a straight bat and nudges into the covers to become the first batsman to reach 2000 runs in international T20 cricket
pushed down to long-on for an easy single. Netherlands are tempting them to hit out, but Taylor and Baz know better
back of a length and just outside off, tapped to deep cover
smacked through square leg. This was full and outside off, but Taylor shuffles across and swipes it away. Waited for the slower ball to reach him and dismissed it
walks across again and looks for the slog over midwicket. Too full for it and gets an inside edge onto his pads
fullish and outside off, driven through the covers and the sweeper has more work to do
darts in a shorter one on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
short ball outside off, pulled away between deep midwicket and long-on
flighted on off stump, strides forward and blocks
tosses it up outside off and Baz stays beside it and slams it through the covers. Waited on it just enough and lashes it away. Strong strike
fires it full and down the leg side, sweeps to short fine leg
flighted on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
and he's been smashed out of the ground. Offers up a length ball outside off and Taylor pulls out that trademark slap over deep midwicket. Way into the crowd

and again, but this is a leading edge! It's a skier, it's going to be difficult. Especially with two men chasing it. But Ben Cooper allows the man with the gloves to take it and so he does. Fullish and outside off, Taylor goes for the same stroke but his timing is nowhere near as good
fullish on middle, Baz blocks down the pitch
low full toss on off stump, Baz drives uppishly through extra cover. There's no one in the circle to catch it though
back of a length and it ducks back in at him. He looks to cut, but it was a little too close for the shot. Beaten
fullish on middle and leg, it was the change of pace. Nudged towards mid-on
fuller delivery on leg stump, tucked away behind square leg
beaten outside off! Netherlands are stringing a few tight overs together. Offcutter grips into the pitch and slides past the outside edge as he looks to prod
beaten again! This time he was hitting against the cut and the closed face of the bat goes against him. Beaten outside off stump by the offcutter
fullish and outside off, guided away to deep point
fullish delivery, chipped just over cover. Came on the front foot and evaded the leaping fielder
full on leg stump, Baz pulls out the lap sweep to long leg
tried to nudge it off the pads, but doesn't connect with the bat. Settles for a leg bye to midwicket
full toss just outside off, Anderson jams it away past point

low full toss on leg stump and Baz has dispatched it over the square leg boundary. There was a man on the boundary, but he needed to have been on the rope! Had he been hugging the boundary, he might have pulled off a good, leaping catch
fullish on off stump, pushes into the off side and races off for a single
attempts the reverse scoop again, this time it's the quicker ball outside off that defeats Baz.
skips down the track to convert the fuller delivery into a low full toss, slices through the covers to the sweeper
goes down the track and gets it off the bottom of the bat towards long-on. The mistiming helps him get back the strike with a couple
six over extra to bring up his half-century! This time the charge works perfectly and a clean swing of the bat sends it way over the rope
slower ball on middle and leg, turned away to long leg. Well adjusted
creamed down the ground! Walked at him and smears the slower ball to the left of the bowler and right of long-on. Too well hit for both of them
waits on the back foot and tapes it through the covers
change of pace as this is a good length ball on leg stump, worked away for a couple to long leg
full and wide of off stump, Anderson is on the front foot and drills it to long-on
there she goes! Length ball picked up and smacked over square leg. Hit flat and hard
shortish and just outside off, cut away to point
right through point! Baz makes a bit of room to try and find the gap between backward point and cover point. Succeeds

slower ball swallows McCullum! Teases him with a fuller one outside off and he went into the shot too early. Slices it into the and the fielder from the deep runs in and picks up a lovely tumbling catch around the cover area. Things just got murky for New Zealand
slower ball, into the block hole on leg stump, Pushed down to long-on
tonked over deep midwicket! These were happening every other ball in Queenstown! Slower ball on leg stump, but he allowed the batsman to get under it and Anderson has smoked it for a 93m six
full and just outside off, drives through the covers for a single
fullish on off stump, driven down the ground to long-off
another slower ball on the pads, clipped away to deep midwicket
back of a length on off stump, turned away to the vacant midwicket area. Singles can do it for NZ and Borren is not bothering to pull his field up
full on off stump draws him forward into a drive to the man at cover
good length ball outside off, pushed through to deep cover
full and wide outside off, slammed down the ground to long-off
back of a length and outside off, chops it to cover
full on middle, he's whipped it between midwicket and long-on
shortish and outside off, Neesh cuts to point
digs it in short and his direction is all wrong. Goes way down leg
fullish on middle, tucked away through to the man at deep midwicket and they race through for the two runs that seals their highest successful chase in World T20
